place: University of National and World Economy
field: Bachelor in Business Informatics and Communications
summary: Studied general economic subjects and statistics, computing system architectures, internet technologies, computer networks and telecommunications, operating systems, database programming.
Studied technologies and models for building web and mobile systems and applications. Enterprise resource management systems, business intelligent systems.
Developed, designed UI and managed integrated information systems based on client-server technologies.

Worked with .NET platform using C#, linear data structures, associative arrays, streams, files and directories, classes and objects, functional programming with LINQ. Learned the main OOP principles using object-oriented modeling and building class hierarchies adhering to the five SOLID principles. Looked through the most commonly used design patterns. Did component testing and TDD, used Reflection and events.

Developed information systems with MSSQL using the relational model and ER diagrams. Used SQL for Data Manipulation â€” Extraction, Selection, Projection, Connections, Aggregation, Grouping, Modification, Deletion and Insertion. Worked with ACID transactions and transactional processing.  Used EF Core's ORM technology to map between relational DB's and object-oriented model (DB First / Code First), executing DB queries and CRUD operations.

Used ASP.NET Core to build web apps with MVC architecture using HTML5, MSSQL and EF Core. Defined models, views, partial views with Razor View Engine and Controllers. Worked with the HTTP protocol, Users, Roles and Sessions, Cookies, using AJAX, caching, web application security, web sockets and MVC Controls.

Used JS to build SPA applications. Worked with functions, arrays and matrices, objects and classes. Learned about complex concepts such as Function Context, Explicit Binding, Event Loop, Inheritance, Object Composition and Prototype Chaining. Manipulated the DOM tree, handled different events. Worked with the HTTP protocol, REST and Baas Services. Used Promises, async/await to write Asynchronous code. Built apps using Routing and Templating, using Custom Web Components and raising a Webpack environment from scratch.
Worked with EpiServer/Optimizely CMS to extend its functionality based on client requirements by customizing reusable components with Blocks and Pages.
Led the development of a content migration for moving data from older EpiServer version to latest Optimizely version.

Used PDFsharp, MigraDoc, HtmlRenderer,PdfSharp, iText libraries to work with various PDF generation related tasks (populating predefined AcroField templates, generating catalogs of products, converting RichText fields to PDF files, etc.).
Wrote plugins for the EpiServer/Optimizely CMS to extend its functionality.
Led development and modernization of an HR project using .NET8 with controller-based Web API, React + TypeScript, Azure and Microsoft Graph API.
Worked with Azure Functions with CRON expressions to schedule and send recurring, rule-based emails with options for email templatization using an Abstract Factory, etc.

Built fully custom React components for differnt requirement modules which included scheduling logic, targeted groups, recurring intervals and reporting. In addition to the custom built components, used FluentUI components, React Multi Date Picker components, MSAL and other frontend libraries.
skills: Azure (App Services, SQL databases, Storage, Functions)
